title: How to Make Potato Salad for 50 People

steps.headline: Leaving the skins on, cook the potatoes in salted water until easily pierced with a fork.
steps.description: The skins may split, which is fine. You can cook in batches. Choose potatoes roughly all the same size for even cooking. You can cut larger potatoes in half before cooking.

steps.headline: Drain water off the potatoes once cooked.
Set the potatoes onto a cookie sheet to cool slightly.
steps.description: You can cool them on the counter or in the refrigerator.

steps.headline: When potatoes are still warm, peel them.
steps.description: If you like the skins on, skip peeling them and just cube them.

steps.headline: Cut the peeled potatoes into uniform cubes measuring about 3/4 of an inch.
steps.description: Salt and pepper the cubed potatoes lightly.

steps.headline: Place the cubes into large bowl.
In a separate large bowl, add all of the remaining ingredients except for the eggs and milk.
Add the milk and mix again.
steps.description: The milk thins out the dressing so that is easier to spread.

steps.headline: Add the chopped eggs to the potatoes.
steps.description: Fold them in gently to mix the potato and egg mixture together.

steps.headline: Add the dressing.
steps.description: Stir gently to coat the potatoes and eggs with it. Try not to break up the potatoes too much.

steps.headline: Store the potato salad at a cool temperature, between 35-40 degrees/1.6-4.4ºC.
Serve in one large bowl or several small ones.
steps.description: You can serve this dish over ice to keep it cold. Place a slightly larger bowl with ice in it under the bowl of potato salad.
